name: cfcache
description:
Stores a copy of a page on the server and/or client computer,
 to improve page rendering performance. To do this, the tag
 creates temporary files that contain the static HTML returned
 from a CFML page.

 Use this tag if it is not necessary to get dynamic content each
 time a user accesses a page.
 You can use this tag for simple URLs and for URLs that contain
 URL parameters.

params.name: action
params.description:
* cache: server-side and client-side caching.
 * flush: refresh cached page(s).
 * clientcache: browser-side caching only. To cache a personalized page, use this option.
 * servercache: server-side caching only. Not recommended.
 * optimal: same as "cache".

params.name: timespan
params.description: The interval until the page is flushed from the cache.

params.name: expireurl
params.description:
Used with action = "flush". A URL reference. CFML
 matches it against the mappings in the specified cache
 directory. Can include wildcards. For example:
 "*/view.cfm?id=*".

params.name: port
params.description: Remote port to which to connect

params.name: protocol
params.description: Protocol that is used to create URL from cache.

params.name: value
params.description: For action="set", object which needs to be stored

params.name: throwonerror
params.description:
A Boolean value specifying whether to throw an error if the
flush action encounters an error. Otherwise the action does not
generate an error if it fails. If this attribute is 'true' you can handle the
error in a cfcatch block,for example, if a specified id value is invalid

params.name: usecache
params.description: to use cache or not (if false it will process the content each time)

params.name: dependson
params.description: Comma seperated list of all variables on which this cache would depend

params.name: idletime
params.description: Flushes the cached item if it is not accessed for the specified time span.

params.name: name
params.description: name of return variable, valid with action="get"

examples.title: Adding a page to the cache
examples.code: Hello World!
examples.description: Puts HTML page into the cache and uses the cached version on subsequent calls to the page.

examples.title: Flushing a page from the cache
examples.description: Flushes the 'hello-world.cfm' page from the cache.
